doc.field: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials

This series collects a variety of serials and publications largely issued by institutions specializing in labor research and history. These include newsletters and catalogs produced by the George Meany Center for Labor Studies and the School of Industrial and Labor Relations, as well as material published by smaller organizations like the American Labor Museum, Ozarks' Labor Union Archive, and New England Free Press. Other titles include independently produced reports on topics including collective bargaining, outsourcing in manufacturing, and general strikes in France; catalogues rounding up labor titles distributed by Greenwood Press and Charles H. Kerr & Co; and a journal of new workplace technology, Black Chip.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials
